author: Yian Lee, Miaojung Lin, Cindy Wang, Annabelle Droulers
description: Military’s stockpile of about 1,000 drones seen as inadequate in the case of conflict with China
title: Taiwan Struggles to Build a Drone Defense Without Its Tech Giants

author: Olga Kharif, Zeke Faux
description: Top holders of Donald Trump’s memecoin and other guests were greeted by protesters as they arrived for a dinner with the president at his golf club outside of Washington on Thursday, a day which saw Bitcoin extend its record high amid optimism about US government support for the crypto industry.
title: Protesters Yell ‘Shame!’ at Guests of Trump’s Memecoin Dinner

author: Mark Niquette
description: On May 22, the US House of Representatives passed a multi-trillion dollar bill that implements President Donald Trump’s domestic agenda. The legislation would extends the tax cuts implemented in Trump’s first term, which were set to expire, and allocate billions of dollars to defense, immigration enforcement, and other administration priorities. The measure now moves to the Senate, which is expected to make significant changes. Here’s what to know.
title: A Guide to Trump’s Tax Cuts: What’s in His ‘Big, Beautiful’ Bill

author: Erik Wasson, Emily Birnbaum, Ari Natter
description: House Republicans narrowly passed President Donald Trump’s economic package after a series of all-night negotiations and 11th-hour compromises.
title: SALT Write-Off, Harvard Tax, Medicaid Cuts: What’s in Trump’s Bill

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof said President Donald Trump has confirmed that he planned to attend the North Atlantic Treaty Organization’s June summit in The Hague.
title: Dutch Leader Says Trump Plans to Attend NATO Summit in The Hague

author: Daniel Flatley, William Horobin, Erik Hertzberg, Kamil Kowalcze
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent kept a low public profile during this week’s gathering of finance chiefs of the world’s top industrialized nations. But he made a noted impact privately, people involved in the Group of Seven gathering said.
title: Bessent Wins G-7 Partner Plaudits in First Conference Abroad

description: Beijing wants a high-tech economy built on domestic supply, even if it comes at a cost.
title: China’s Lithium City Is a Front Line of the Battery Trade War

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court shielded the Federal Reserve from Donald Trump’s push to oust top officials at independent federal agencies.
title: Supreme Court Shields Fed as It Lets Trump Fire Agency Leaders

author: Emily Nicolle
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, crypto reporter Emily Nicolle looks at tonight’s dinner for top holders of the $TRUMP memecoin. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Some Tokens of Appreciation for a Dinner With Trump

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday appointed a new head of the Shin-Bet domestic intelligence agency, ignoring his own attorney general’s legal guidance and exacerbating a weeks-long battle over the previous chief’s ouster.
title: Netanyahu Names New Shin Bet Chief in Defiance of Legal Guidance

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria’s ruling All Progressives Congress party has endorsed President Bola Tinubu as its candidate for the 2027 election, after top opposition leaders agreed to unite ahead of the ballot.
title: Nigeria’s Ruling Party Backs Tinubu for Second Term as President

author: Ryan Chua
description: US Ambassador to NATO Matthew Whitaker said the alliance needs to present clear steps to meet a defense spending target of 5% of economic output with a focus on “hard defense capabilities,” as member-states work to put together a deal that meets President Donald Trump’s demand.
title: US Wants Clear NATO Plan to Boost Defense Budgets, Whitaker Says

author: Jamie Tarabay, Roxana Tiron
description: Senate Republicans are warning Russia that they’re prepared to pass punishing sanctions if President Vladimir Putin refuses to engage in ceasefire negotiations with Ukraine or breaches an eventual agreement.
title: US Senate Considering Action on Punishing Russia Sanctions Bill

author: Joe Deaux
description: United Steelworkers President David McCall urged President Donald Trump to block Nippon Steel Corp.’s bid to purchase United States Steel Corp., reiterating his opposition to the controversial proposed merger.
title: Steelworkers Boss Urges Trump to Block Takeover of US Steel

author: Courtney McBride, Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon’s plans to deploy a new missile-defense system to protect Guam are faltering because of organizational lapses, a congressional watchdog said.
title: Guam Defense System Facing Delays, Planning Problems, GAO Says

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Janet Lorin
description: The Trump Administration told Harvard University it can’t enroll international students, delivering a major blow to the school after the government froze billions of dollars of federal funding.
title: Harvard Blocked by US from Enrolling Foreign Students

author: Misha Savic, Jasmina Kuzmanovic
description: France and Germany have drafted a set of options to financially and politically isolate, including with sanctions, officials in Bosnia’s Serb-majority region whose bid to secede has plunged the Balkan country into crisis, according to a letter seen by Bloomberg News.
title: EU Nations Mull Options to Rein In Separatist Leader in Bosnia

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump will attend the Group of Seven summit in June, the White House said, as tensions over trade and his efforts to halt Russia’s war in Ukraine cloud US ties with some of its closest allies.
title: Trump to Attend G-7 Leaders’ Summit in Canada in June

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said she discussed US steel and aluminum tariffs on Thursday, in her latest call with Donald Trump.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Says She Talked Steel Tariffs in Latest Trump Call

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Keir Starmer is at odds with his powerful chief of staff over whether to scrap a two-child cap on benefits, according to multiple people familiar with the matter, a costly policy move that the British prime minister is under pressure to make after bruising local election results.
title: Starmer and Top Aide Clash Over £2.5 Billion Child Benefit Cap

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain’s government is pushing ahead with a controversial proposal to hit non-European Union residents with a 100% tax when buying homes, as it seeks to tackle a brewing housing crisis.
title: Spain Pushes Ahead With Plan to Tax Non-EU Home Buyers 100%

author: Manuela Tobias, Patrick Gillespie
description: President Javier Milei proposed an overhaul of Argentina’s tax system in order to cut red tape and encourage use of greenbacks that were previously undeclared.
title: Milei’s Revamp Lets Argentines Send $43,700, No Questions Asked

author: Ben Sills
description: The US and European leaders are placing their hopes in the Vatican to engage Russia and Ukraine in peace talks, after President Donald Trump said Pope Leo XIV had expressed interest in the idea. The Kremlin isn’t so keen.
title: Russia Douses Trump’s Eagerness for Pope to Host Ukraine Talks

author: Gregory Korte, Liz Capo McCormick, Nancy Cook
description: President Donald Trump cut a deal with blue-state Republicans on taxes and put down an 11th-hour rebellion by conservatives over spending to get his “one big, beautiful bill” passed by the House.
title: Trump’s Next Hurdle: The Bond Market Hates His ‘Beautiful’ Tax Bill

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The Trump administration issued a report blaming the rise in chronic diseases in the US on unhealthy food ingredients, chemicals, overreliance on medication and corporate spending. But it stopped short of attacking growers and manufacturers as much as they feared.
title: RFK Jr. Report Blames Diet, Overmedication for Chronic Diseases

author: Gresa Kraja, Max Ramsay
description: The European Union has started to “gradually lift” punitive measures imposed on Kosovo, the bloc’s foreign-affairs chief Kaja Kallas said.
title: EU Has Begun Lifting Measures Imposed on Kosovo, Kallas Says

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia has started to create a buffer zone along its border with Ukraine as the Kremlin continues efforts to strengthen defenses in neighboring regions against attacks.
title: Putin Says Russia Creating Buffer Zone Along Ukrainian Border

author: Nicholas Comfort
description: Water has emerged as the single biggest nature-related risk to euro area economy, according to the European Central Bank and researchers at the University of Oxford.
title: ECB Says Water Is Top Nature-Related Risk to European Economy

author: Ntando Thukwana, S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s finance chief said the government made progress on resetting its relationship with the US and securing a trade deal in talks that took place after President Cyril Ramaphosa’s showdown with Donald Trump at the White House.
title: South Africa Expects US Reset Despite White House Confrontation

author: David Voreacos
description: The US sued four “sanctuary cities” in New Jersey, claiming they are blocking the work of federal immigration officials, as the Trump administration seeks to remove obstacles to its mass deportation plans.
title: New Jersey ‘Sanctuary Cities’ Sued by Trump Administration Over Immigration Policies

author: Josh Sisco
description: The Justice Department is probing whether Alphabet Inc.’s Google violated antitrust law with an agreement to use the artificial intelligence technology of a popular chatbot maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Google Faces Antitrust Investigation Over Deal for AI-Fueled Chatbots

author: Ari Natter
description: The US Senate voted to block a California program banning gasoline-powered cars and other vehicles by 2035, sending the measure to President Donald Trump’s desk for his signature.
title: Senate Votes to End California Gas-Car Ban, Sends Bill to Trump

author: Jon Herskovitz
description: North Korea has placed a cover over a destroyer that suffered damage in a botched launch attempt, with the vessel now appearing to be on its side and partially submerged, satellite imagery indicates.
title: North Korean Warship Seen Severely Damaged After Failed Launch

author: Alicia Clanton
description: A group of California mayors and Assembly members unveiled a sweeping legislative package aimed at rescuing the state’s downtowns from the lingering economic effects of the pandemic.
title: California Politicians Push 13-Bill Package to Rescue Downtowns

author: Kamlesh Bhuckory, Joe Mayes
description: The UK and Mauritius agreed to a deal regarding the sovereignty of an Indian Ocean archipelago, including control over a key strategic military base in the region, ending a long-running negotiation that had become a point of controversy for British premier Keir Starmer.
title: UK to Pay Mauritius £101 Million a Year to Use Indian Ocean Base

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court divided evenly in a major case over the separation of religion and government, thwarting an effort in Oklahoma to create the nation’s first faith-based charter school.
title: Supreme Court Splits 4-4 in Setback to Religious Charter School

author: Lillianna Byington, Ken Tran
description: The Republican legislative balancing act now shifts to the Senate.
title: Senate’s Arcane Rules, Desire for Changes Will Slow Budget Bill

author: Michael Cohen
description: Land ownership remains an explosive issue in South Africa more than three decades after White-minority rule ended. It’s also at the center of a diplomatic row with the US, as President Donald Trump and his Pretoria-born billionaire ally Elon Musk falsely claim that the South African government is engaging in land grabs and that there’s a genocide against White Afrikaner farmers.
title: Why South Africa’s Land Law Is at Heart of Trump Row

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s opposition candidate for president, Karol Nawrocki, said he won’t support NATO membership for Ukraine and is “more critical” than the incumbent toward Kyiv, as he seeks to court far-right voters ahead of a runoff in a closely-contested election.
title: Polish Presidential Hopeful Says Opposes Ukraine Joining NATO

author: Daniel Flatley, Jorge Valero, William Horobin
description: Finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of Seven nations pledged to address “excessive imbalances” in the global economy, an effort clearly aimed at China, though a draft communique seen by Bloomberg News omitted the name of the country.
title: G-7 Draft Warns of ‘Excessive Imbalances’ in Global Economy

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk warned on Thursday that the Baltic Sea is becoming “a new area of confrontation” with Russia, putting the country’s critical infrastructure increasingly at risk.
title: Poland Says Key Infrastructure at Risk After Baltic Sea Incident

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran warned it would take action against Israel and hold the US “legally responsible” if the Jewish state acts on reported plans to attack the Islamic Republic’s nuclear facilities.
title: Iran Warns Israel of Reprisals for Any Strikes on Nuclear Sites

author: Liezel Hill
description: Moscow’s famed metro system has unveiled a Soviet-era monument to Josef Stalin in one of its central stations, as part of a gradual reappraisal of the dictator’s legacy in Russia.
title: Moscow Installs Replica of Historical Stalin Monument in Metro

author: Greg Ryan
description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology is enrolling fewer graduate students in its vaunted research programs and laying off employees as the Trump administration’s squeeze on universities muddles its financial outlook.
title: MIT Cuts Grad Student Slots by 8% as Trump Cuts Weigh on Budget

author: James Regan, Angelina Rascouet
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking to deepen economic ties with China as the European Union adjusts to the twin shocks of the American trade war and the continuing Russian invasion of Ukraine.
title: Macron Talks Up China Ties and Touts Progress on Cognac

author: Paul Burkhardt
description: Renergen Ltd., a South African gas explorer, said discussions on a merger with a Washington-based firm predated Donald Trump’s second term and were independent of South Africa’s efforts to smooth over its fractious relations with the US.
title: South African Gas Firm Renergen Says Merger Talks Predate Trump

author: Brian Kahn, Eliyahu Kamisher
description: While California High-Speed Rail’s federal funding is in doubt, privately led Brightline West has been chugging along.
title: Trump’s Funding Threats Build a Case for Private High-Speed Rail

author: Andreina Itriago
description: In Venezuela’s capital city, there’s hardly any sign that an election will take place this Sunday.
title: Maduro Is Using Local Elections to Cement His Grip on Venezuela

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson, Maeve Sheehey
description: President Donald Trump’s signature tax bill narrowly passed the House Thursday morning, advancing a sprawling multi-trillion dollar package that would avert a year-end tax increase at the expense of adding to the US debt burden.
title: Trump Tax Bill Narrowly Passes House, Overcoming Infighting

author: Sam Dagher, Samy Adghirni, Fiona MacDonald
description: France and Saudi Arabia are working on a proposal to disarm the Iran-backed militant group Hamas and pave the way for its demobilization, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: France and Saudi Arabia Aim to Disarm Hamas in New Peace Push

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: An Ivory Coast court ruled that former Credit Suisse AG Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam was ineligible to lead the country’s main opposition party when he was elected in 2023 because of his French citizenship at the time.
title: Ivorian Court Rules Against Thiam as Party Leadership Unaffected

author: Swati Gupta
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi ruled out any talks with Islamabad, and vowed to make Pakistan’s economy and army pay for any aggression on Indian soil, as tensions between the South Asian neighbors remain high a month after deadly Kashmir attacks.
title: Modi Rules Out Talks With Pakistan a Month After Kashmir Attacks

author: S'thembile Cele
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Pitfalls of an Oval Office Meeting With Trump

author: Loukia Gyftopoulou, Joe Deaux, Marion Halftermeyer
description: Ben Black has no formal experience working in Washington and a limited Wall Street resume. Yet the son of billionaire Apollo Global Management Inc. co-founder Leon Black is now set to run an agency with a growing role in White House policy — the US International Development Finance Corp.
title: Leon Black's Son Brings Wall Street Vibe to US Foreign Investment Agency

author: Michael Nienaber, Milda Seputyte
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said his military is prepared to defend the Baltic region against “any threat” as he arrived in Lithuania to mark the establishment of a battle tank brigade to bolster NATO’s eastern flank.
title: Merz Says Germany Will Defend Against ‘Any Threat’ in Baltics

author: Neil Munshi
description: South Africans watched aghast on Wednesday as US President Donald Trump berated their leader in the Oval Office over false claims that there’s a genocide against White people in the country.
title: Trump’s Ambush of Ramaphosa Leaves South Africa Reeling

author: Benoit Berthelot
description: The Hungarian film institute’s booth at the Cannes Film Festival has a glossy brochure promoting a studio complex on the outskirts of Budapest. Next to a mock medieval village, it has a cluster of wood-paneled houses described as an “American suburb.” The set has been used to shoot US productions like Universal’s 2022 horror comedy The Munsters at a fraction of what it would cost to make in Hollywood.
title: Wes Anderson, De Niro Push Back Against Trump Tariffs in Cannes

author: Lucy White
description: Net migration to the UK tumbled nearly 50% to 431,000 last year, a record drop and a welcome development for Prime Minister Keir Starmer as he tries to win back voters attracted by Nigel Farage’s right-wing Reform party.
title: Net Migration to UK Halves as Record Drop Boosts Starmer

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: A Thai court ordered former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra to pay a 10.03 billion baht ($306 million) fine for losses incurred under her administration’s controversial rice purchase program over a decade ago.
title: Thai Court Orders Ex-Premier Yingluck to Pay $306 Million Fine, Reports Say

author: Lucca De Paoli, Upmanyu Trivedi
description: The UK government was temporarily blocked from transferring the ownership of the Chagos Islands after a High Court judge issued an injunction in the early hours of Thursday morning.
title: UK Blocked from Signing Chagos Islands Deal by High Court

author: Swati Gupta
description: Indian security forces killed a top Maoist rebel leader, Home Affairs Minister Amit Shah said, calling it a “major breakthrough” in the nation’s decades-long fight against the left-wing extremism.
title: India Says Top Maoist Rebel Killed in ‘Major Breakthrough’

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: The European Union’s investment vehicle is investing €40 million ($45 million) in a dedicated European defense fund, marking a first as the bloc seeks to improve its military capabilities.
title: EU Puts €40 Million in First Foray Into Dedicated Defense Fund

author: Ben Sills
description: Moscow is facing a second day of large-scale drone attacks, causing delays for dozens of flights with airports around the Russian capital forced to temporarily halt operations overnight.
title: Moscow Faces Second Day of Drone Attacks, Disrupting Flights

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Finance ministers from the Group of Seven industrialized nations have agreed to continue backing Ukraine in its defense against Russia’s invasion, German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said on the sidelines of a G-7 meeting in Canada.
title: Germany Says G-7 Finance Chiefs Agree Continued Ukraine Support

author: Augusta Saraiva, Michael Sasso
description: US job openings in research and development are plunging as the Trump administration ramps up funding cuts to government agencies, private contractors and universities, leaving some of the nation’s brightest minds scrambling to find work.
title: Trump’s Research Funding Cuts Create Job Drought for Scientists

author: Myles Miller, John Harney
description: Two members of the Israeli embassy’s staff were fatally shot outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington on Wednesday night, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said.
title: Two Israeli Embassy Staffers Killed in Washington Shooting

author: Yongchang Chin, Crayton Harrison
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said in a post on X that a Venezuela oil-export license will expire next Tuesday, defying earlier expectations that it would be extended.
title: Rubio Says Venezuela Oil Export License Will Expire Next Week

author: Michael Nienaber, Milda Seputyte
description: Germany is ramping up its battle tank brigade in Lithuania to strengthen NATO’s eastern flank as European allies take unprecedented steps to deter an increasingly hostile Russia.
title: Germany Scales Up Battle Tank Brigade in Baltics to Deter Russia

author: Alastair Gale
description: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said Japan and its allies should deepen cooperation in the development of weapons and other defense equipment as threats mount across the Asia-Pacific region.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Calls for Closer Weapons Development With Allies

author: Ainsley Thomson
description: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis had billed Thursday’s budget as a sober affair that would contain “no unicorns, no rainbows.”
title: New Zealand Budget 2025: Winners and Losers

author: Tracy Withers
description: New Zealand’s government is introducing a new tax incentive to increase business investment as it seeks to lift productivity and stoke economic growth.
title: New Zealand Targets Investment With Budget Tax Incentive

author: Michelle Kaske
description: Transportation projects in Manhattan may be at risk of losing federal approval or funds after New York Governor Kathy Hochul rejected US Secretary of Transportation Sean Duffy’s demand to end congestion pricing or face potential consequences.
title: Hochul Digs In on Toll, Risking Federal Funds for NYC Projects

author: Steven T. Dennis, Ari Natter, Erik Wasson
description: House Republican leaders released a new version of President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill with a higher limit on the deduction for state and local taxes and other changes in a bid to win over warring GOP factions to support the legislation.
title: House Republicans Release Trump Tax Bill With Larger SALT Cap

author: Shinhye Kang, Seyoon Kim
description: North Korea suffered a “serious accident” during the launch ceremony for a new destroyer Wednesday, an event that was overseen by leader Kim Jong Un, the state-run Korean Central News Agency said.
title: Kim Jong Un Slams ‘Serious’ Warship Accident at Launch Ceremony

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s lawmakers approved a measure to repair the country’s bureaucratic permitting process, drawing the ire of environmentalists who said the action dismantles key protections.
title: Brazil Eases Environmental Rules Ahead of Key UN Climate Summit

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK urged its Group of Seven allies to agree a cut to the price cap on Russian oil, saying the move is necessary to put further pressure on President Vladimir Putin to end Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: UK Urges Cut to Russian Oil Price Cap at G7 to Pressure Putin

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has called for the courtesy resignation of all his Cabinet secretaries in a push to “recalibrate” his administration following his slate’s underwhelming performance at last week’s Senate election.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Tells All Ministers to Quit in ‘Bold Reset’

author: Maya Averbuch
description: Mexico City’s top security official said at least four people were involved in the fatal shootings of two of Mayor Clara Brugada’s aides in one of the country’s highest-profile examples of political violence in years.
title: Mexico City Takes Steps To Find Killer of Mayor’s Aides

author: Joanna Ossinger
description: Singapore’s government on Wednesday said it rejects attempts by foreign embassies in the city-state to “incite domestic reactions on international issues involving third countries.”
title: Singapore Warns Foreign Embassies Against Stirring Up Reactions
